definitions.definition: A force compounded by means of a lever rotating around a pivot .
examples: A crowbar uses leverage to pry nails out of wood.

definitions.definition: Any influence which is compounded or used to gain an advantage .
examples: Try using competitors’ prices for leverage in the negotiation.

definitions.definition: The use of borrowed funds with a contractually determined return to increase the ability to invest and earn an expected higher return, but usually at high risk.
examples: Leverage is great until something goes wrong with your investments and you still have to pay your debts.

definitions.definition: The ability to earn very high returns when operating at high-capacity utilization of a facility.
examples: Their variable-cost-reducing investments have dramatically increased their leverage .

definitions.definition: The distance of between an independent observation and other observations.
